info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bertie, southwestern Hertford and southwestern Chowan Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lewiston Woodville to near Plymouth. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Aulander around 655 PM EDT. Ahoskie and Powellsville around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Goose Pond, Whites Crossroads, Merry Hill, Earleys, Connaritsa, Edenhouse, Republican, Trap, Mount Gould and Quitsna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
